name: Bodyweight Squat
description: Fundamental lower body exercise targeting quadriceps, glutes, and hamstrings while improving functional movement patterns
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly turned out
Keep chest up and core engaged throughout the movement
Lower your body by pushing hips back and bending knees
Descend until thighs are parallel to the floor (or as low as comfortable)
Drive through heels to return to starting position
Keep knees tracking over toes, don't let them cave inward
tips: Keep weight in your heels, not on toes
Don't let knees cave inward
Maintain neutral spine throughout movement
Control the descent - don't drop down quickly

name: Push-Up
description: Classic upper body exercise targeting chest, shoulders, and triceps while engaging core for stability
instructions: Start in plank position with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width
Keep body in straight line from head to heels
Lower chest toward ground by bending elbows
Keep elbows at 45-degree angle to body, not flared out
Push back up to starting position
Maintain core engagement throughout movement
tips: Don't let hips sag or pike up
Keep head in neutral position
Full range of motion - chest should nearly touch floor
Breathe in on the way down, out on the way up

name: Modified Push-Up
description: Beginner-friendly push-up variation performed on knees, maintaining proper form while reducing load
instructions: Start in plank position, then lower knees to ground
Keep straight line from head to knees
Place hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart
Lower chest toward ground by bending elbows
Keep elbows at 45-degree angle to body
Push back up to starting position
tips: Don't sit back on heels - maintain forward lean
Keep core engaged even with knees down
Focus on controlled movement over speed
Progress to full push-ups when ready

name: Standard Plank
description: Isometric core exercise building stability, strength, and endurance in deep core muscles
instructions: Start in push-up position with forearms on ground
Keep elbows directly under shoulders
Maintain straight line from head to heels
Engage core by pulling belly button toward spine
Keep hips level - don't let them sag or pike up
Breathe steadily throughout the hold
tips: Focus on quality over duration
Keep shoulders away from ears
Don't hold breath - maintain steady breathing
Stop if form breaks down

name: Side Plank
description: Unilateral core exercise targeting obliques and improving lateral stability and strength
instructions: Lie on side with forearm on ground, elbow under shoulder
Stack feet on top of each other
Lift hips up creating straight line from head to feet
Keep top arm on hip or extended toward ceiling
Hold position while breathing steadily
Repeat on other side
tips: Don't let hips drop or rotate
Keep head in neutral position
Modify by dropping to knees if needed
Focus on lifting from core, not just arm

name: Mountain Climbers
description: Dynamic high-intensity exercise combining cardio and core strength while engaging multiple muscle groups
instructions: Start in plank position with hands under shoulders
Keep core tight and body in straight line
Drive right knee toward chest, then quickly switch
Alternate legs in running motion
Keep hips level throughout movement
Maintain steady breathing rhythm
tips: Start slow and build up speed
Don't let hips bounce up and down
Keep shoulders stable over hands
Land softly on balls of feet

name: Jumping Jacks
description: Classic cardio exercise that elevates heart rate while improving coordination and full-body mobility
instructions: Start standing with feet together, arms at sides
Jump while spreading legs shoulder-width apart
Simultaneously raise arms overhead
Jump back to starting position
Land softly on balls of feet
Maintain steady rhythm
tips: Keep core engaged throughout
Land softly to protect joints
Keep arms straight during movement
Modify by stepping instead of jumping if needed

name: Burpees
description: Full-body high-intensity exercise combining squat, plank, push-up, and jump for maximum calorie burn
instructions: Start standing with feet shoulder-width apart
Drop into squat position, place hands on ground
Jump feet back into plank position
Perform push-up (optional for beginners)
Jump feet back to squat position
Jump up with arms overhead
tips: Focus on form over speed
Step back instead of jumping if needed
Keep core engaged throughout
Modify by removing push-up or jump

name: Lunges
description: Unilateral lower body exercise targeting legs and glutes while improving balance and stability
instructions: Start standing with feet hip-width apart
Step forward with right leg into lunge position
Lower hips until both knees are at 90 degrees
Keep front knee over ankle, not pushed out past toes
Push back to starting position
Alternate legs or complete set on one side
tips: Keep torso upright throughout movement
Don't let front knee cave inward
Step far enough forward for proper form
Control the descent - don't drop down

name: High Knees
description: Cardio exercise that improves running form, hip flexor strength, and cardiovascular endurance
instructions: Start standing with feet hip-width apart
Run in place lifting knees toward chest
Aim to bring knees up to waist level
Keep core engaged and posture upright
Pump arms naturally as if running
Maintain quick, light steps
tips: Stay on balls of feet
Keep breathing steady
Focus on knee height over speed
Land softly to protect joints

name: Dumbbell Squats
description: Loaded squat variation using dumbbells to increase resistance and challenge lower body strength
instructions: Hold dumbbells at shoulder height or at sides
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Keep chest up and core engaged
Lower by pushing hips back and bending knees
Descend until thighs are parallel to floor
Drive through heels to return to standing
tips: Keep dumbbells close to body
Don't let knees cave inward
Maintain neutral spine
Control the weight throughout movement

name: Dumbbell Chest Press
description: Upper body pressing exercise targeting chest, shoulders, and triceps using dumbbells for full range of motion
instructions: Lie on bench or floor with dumbbells in hands
Start with dumbbells at chest level, elbows bent
Press weights up until arms are fully extended
Lower weights with control back to starting position
Keep core engaged throughout movement
Maintain steady breathing pattern
tips: Don't let weights drift too far apart
Keep shoulders pulled back and down
Control the negative portion of movement
Don't bounce weights off chest

name: Dumbbell Rows
description: Pulling exercise targeting back muscles and biceps while improving posture and upper body strength
instructions: Hinge at hips with dumbbells hanging at arms' length
Keep back straight and core engaged
Pull dumbbells to sides of torso
Squeeze shoulder blades together at top
Lower weights with control
Keep elbows close to body throughout movement
tips: Don't round back during movement
Focus on pulling with back muscles, not arms
Keep head in neutral position
Control the weight on both up and down phases

name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press
description: Overhead pressing exercise targeting shoulders and triceps while engaging core for stability
instructions: Hold dumbbells at shoulder height with palms facing forward
Keep feet shoulder-width apart, core engaged
Press weights directly overhead until arms are fully extended
Lower weights with control back to starting position
Keep elbows slightly in front of body
Maintain neutral spine throughout movement
tips: Don't arch back excessively
Keep core tight to protect lower back
Press weights up and slightly back
Control the descent - don't drop weights

name: Dumbbell Deadlifts
description: Hip-hinge movement targeting posterior chain muscles while building functional strength and power
instructions: Hold dumbbells in front of thighs with overhand grip
Stand with feet hip-width apart, slight bend in knees
Hinge at hips, pushing butt back while lowering weights
Keep back straight and chest up
Lower until you feel stretch in hamstrings
Drive hips forward to return to standing position
tips: Keep weights close to body throughout movement
Don't round back - maintain neutral spine
Focus on hip movement, not knee bending
Keep shoulders pulled back and down

name: Dumbbell Lunges
description: Unilateral lower body exercise with added resistance to challenge balance, strength, and coordination
instructions: Hold dumbbells at sides with arms straight
Step forward into lunge position
Lower hips until both knees are at 90 degrees
Keep front knee over ankle
Push back to starting position
Alternate legs or complete set on one side
tips: Keep torso upright throughout movement
Don't let front knee drift past toes
Keep dumbbells at sides, not swinging
Step far enough forward for proper form
